image.altText: Joe Biden closes eyes as Kamala Harris hugs him on stage at rally

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden ended his re-election bid and pulled out of this year's presidential race, throwing his support behind his Vice-President Kamala Harris.

title.children: Harris vows to 'earn and win' nomination as millions pour in from donors — as it happened

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiling and a man with blond hair and pursed lips

props.synopsis: Never before has a major US political party switched horses midstream this close to a presidential election. There are so many unknowns.

title.children: There's a huge question where no one – not even the Democrats – knows the answer

image.altText: Exterior photos of Parliament House in Hobart, Tasmania bathed in sunshine.

props.synopsis: Letters written with poisoned ink, missiles thrown at politicians' homes and a heated debate about the flooding of Lake Pedder. It was in this climate in 1972 that a shot was fired one night through the window of Tasmania's parliament house.

title.children: The mystery surrounding a 50-year-old bullet hole inside Tasmania's Parliament House

image.altText: President Biden stands in front of a microphone wearing a black suit and blue tie with an American flag pinned to his lapel

props.synopsis: Concerns about the 46th US president's age have been around since his 2020 campaign but after a shambolic debate performance, worries about his capacity for another term became too loud to ignore.

title.children: Biden's legacy will extend beyond his one term in office. But the timing of his exit could have a profound impact on the election

image.altText: Kamala gestures at a podium.

props.synopsis: With US President Joe Biden announcing he will not stand for re-election in November, Kamala Harris is seen as a potential successor. But who is she?

title.children: Kamala Harris is used to breaking barriers. But could she become the first woman to be the US president?

image.altText: emergency services at Carlton rail station after a father and his daughter were killed by an oncoming train

props.synopsis: The bodies of a father and one of his two-year-old twin daughters were removed from Carlton rail station late on Sunday after they were killed when the girls' pram rolled onto tracks.

title.children: Investigators piece together vision moments before 'hero' father tried to save twin daughters from oncoming train

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair.

props.synopsis: Like her mother, Tarnika became addicted to drugs and went to prison. The number of First Nations women being incarcerated is on the rise.

title.children: Tarnika found her mum living in a cardboard box and addicted to drugs

image.altText: Light blue background with a Sydney cityscape in the background with three houses in boxes on top

props.synopsis: We found out the stories behind some of Sydney's empty homes by tracking down owners using property data and other public records and knocking on doors.

title.children: We tracked down the owners of Sydney's 'ghost homes' to try and find out why they've been left vacant

image.altText: Photographed from above, a woman in a sparkly pink top strokes her daughter's hair, who is burying her face into her neck.

props.synopsis: Tasmania is in the throes of a housing crisis, and women and children are particularly vulnerable, according to a recent report. Advocates are especially concerned for those experiencing family violence, calling housing a "key piece of the puzzle".

title.children: Caught in a violent relationship and a housing crisis, Cody's choice was 'either stay or be on the street'

image.altText: Worker welding

props.synopsis: A study by Curtin University has found 90 per cent of welders are being exposed to carcinogenic welding fumes, some at high levels. A public health expert and union official say the issue needs to be taken as seriously as silica and asbestos exposure.

title.children: When Mark inhaled too many fumes as a welding apprentice, he was told to drink 'a cup of milk'

image.altText: A woman waves in front of a blue sky

props.synopsis: Whatever your politics, there was something truly heart-wrenching about the indignity of the last few weeks. But in dragging it out, Biden may have given his vice-president the best possible chance.

title.children: Joe Biden limped on for three weeks. But in doing so, gave Kamala Harris her best chance

image.altText: Kamala Harris and Joe Biden smile at each other

props.synopsis: Joe Biden's withdrawal from the US presidential race has left Democrats in a precarious and chaotic position. Here's how the next few weeks could play out.

title.children: 'Could be literal chaos': Biden isn't running again. Here's what could happen next

image.altText: Tortoise

props.synopsis: Conservationists have successfully released 560 giant tortoises to the Galápagos Islands as part of a scheme to boost the numbers of the animal, which once came close to extinction.

title.children: Hundreds of giant tortoises return to Galápagos Islands as part of conservation program

image.altText: Oscar Piastri sprayed with champange after winning the Hungarian Grand Prix

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has become the fifth Australian to win a Formula 1 grand prix, taking the chequered flag for McLaren in Hungary.

title.children: Oscar Piastri becomes fifth Australian to win F1 grand prix after nervous moment with teammate on last laps

image.altText: A man wearing a dark hoodie pictured from behind, in front of a business called "Harlots".

props.synopsis: William says he and other NDIS participants have the same wants and aspirations as anybody else — and a sex work ban would deny a whole section of the community from a "deeply ingrained human need" based just on their circumstances.

title.children: NDIS participants using sex workers fear ban will deny some people with disability a 'normal life'

image.altText: A missile is fired from a ship over water, with an island in the background.

props.synopsis: The test was conducted at the Rim of the Pacific (RIMPAC) exercise, hosted by the United States off the coast of Hawaii.

title.children: 'Major milestone' as Australian Navy tests out its new Naval Strike Missile during US-hosted military exercises

image.altText: A close up photo of Wendy Ruth Sym wearing black reading glasses.

props.synopsis: A Perth woman collapses in a court dock after being sentenced to nine years in prison for trying to murder her husband who had been diagnosed with dementia.

title.children: Nurse collapses in court after being jailed for attempted murder of husband with insulin

image.altText: Police and emergency services at scene of fatal crash at road intersection.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old passenger in a car with two companions dies in an early morning crash on Sunday in Hobart's city centre.

title.children: Police urge drivers to slow down after teenager dies in Hobart crash over weekend

image.altText: A composite image of a train, bus and a question mark.

props.synopsis: Passenger trains, along with trams and trolley buses, were once part of Tasmania's transport mix. But with cars dominating the roads and a bus system hit by staff shortages and slashed services, could the wheel be finally turning enough for a return to rail?

title.children: It's been 45 years since Tasmania's last passenger train service ran. Could it make a comeback?

image.altText: A person taps a black credit or debit card on a payment terminal.

props.synopsis: Card surcharges are banned in some countries, but they are legal in Australia. Here are some ways you can avoid paying extra.

title.children: Why inserting or swiping your card could help you save on surcharges

image.altText: Biden Trump Albanese

props.synopsis: Joe Biden steps down and Kamala Harris steps up as Donald Trump's overwhelming ascendancy leaves both sides of Australian politics talking about what a second age of Trump would mean.

title.children: Biden dropped out and threw his support behind Kamala. Here's why 2024 could still turn into 'chaos'

image.altText: A bald man in a Hawaiian shirt standing in front of a tree.

props.synopsis: Ashley Paul Griffith was arrested in August 2022 by federal police and charged with multiple Commonwealth child exploitation material offences.

title.children: Former childcare worker accused of sexually assaulting 65 children expedited to a higher court

image.altText: A mock up on the olympic volleyball stadium in front of the effiel tower

props.synopsis: Planning to tune in to the Summer Olympics? Here's a guide to what you can expect and when the key events are scheduled.

title.children: When do the Summer Olympics start? What you need to know ahead of Paris 2024

image.altText: Police officers patrol in front of the Eiffel Tower.

props.synopsis: Staring down 10 million visitors and 10,000 athletes expected to pour in for the Paris Olympics, France's terror alert is at its highest level with the country facing "a challenging time" to host the Games.

title.children: 'We're living in difficult times': A look into the security threats facing the Paris Olympics

image.altText: A woman looks at the myTax website on a computer screen, resting her head on her hand

props.synopsis: The government announced it was changing the HECS indexation rates a few months ago, but the legislation hasn't passed parliament yet.

title.children: Expecting a HECS refund? Here's why you'll have to wait for it

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 has closed down 0.7 per cent after a rough day across most sectors when volatility and risk-aversion dominated trading. Look back at how the day unfolded on our live markets blog.

title.children: ASX 200 closes down 0.5 per cent in a widespread sell-off — as it happened

image.altText: Reece Walsh of the Maroons runs the ball during Game I of the State of Origin

props.synopsis: Reece Walsh says Joseph-Aukuso Sua'ali'i has shown himself as a "class human being" in seeking him out for an on-field apology after State of Origin III.

title.children: Walsh praises 'class human' Sua'ali'i after apology for brutal Origin knock out

image.altText: Glenda Mippy close

props.synopsis: The officer who was in charge on the night a teenager was found unresponsive in his cell at a controversial WA juvenile detention facility is excused from giving evidence at the inquest into the boy's death. WARNING: This story discusses incidents of self-harm and contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: 'It's not right': Cleveland Dodd's family frustrated key witness won't testify at coronial inquest

image.altText: An old Telstra payphone box attached to a blue brick ball with a green alien painted on it.

props.synopsis: Wycliffe Well was once considered the most likely place to encounter an Alien or UFO in Australia, but the roadside stop now resembles a ghost town.

title.children: How Wycliffe Well went from beloved outback roadhouse to a ransacked ghost town

image.altText: Tadej Pogačar holds his bike above his head on the podium after winning the Tour de France.

props.synopsis: Tadej Pogačar is sweeping all before him in men's professional cycling after his historic Tour de France-Giro d'Italia double. It's a dominance that is raising all the usual questions. But Pogačar only has eyes for more success.

title.children: Is Tadej Pogačar the greatest? Even he has to answer uncomfortable questions

image.altText: A green boat is hit with a water cannon being shot by a larger white boat in open sea

props.synopsis: China and the Philippines reach a deal they hope will end confrontations at the most fiercely disputed shoal in the South China Sea. The Philippines government announced the deal on Sunday without providing details.

title.children: China and the Philippines agree to end clashes in South China Sea

image.altText: Tristan Xerri of the Kangaroos and Tom De Koning of the Blues leap for the football during an AFL match

props.synopsis: Carlton star Tom De Koning requires surgery on a fractured foot and will miss the rest of the AFL home-and-away season in a huge blow to the Blues' bid for a top-two spot.

title.children: Fractured foot and collapsed lung puts Carlton ruck's season in doubt

image.altText: A man installs supports for solar panels at a construction site.

props.synopsis: At least one solar project has been put on hold indefinitely, as some energy investors grow nervous over whether renewables will still be supported under the Coalition's nuclear proposal.

title.children: Solar industry sees first projects put on ice as nuclear proposal sows doubt among investors
